name: Camunda 8 (SaaS/Self-Managed)
description: Our primary engine for high-throughput process orchestration. Essential for state management in complex AI agent handoffs.

name: Embedded Camunda 7 Engines
description: Phasing out in favor of Camunda 8. No new projects should use embedded Spring Boot C7 architectures.

name: Kubernetes
description: Kubernetes is the de facto standard for container orchestration, enabling automated deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.

name: Docker
description: Docker is a platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers, providing consistency across multiple development and release cycles.

name: Istio
description: An open-source service mesh that provides a way to control how microservices share data with one another.

name: Kafka
description: A distributed event streaming platform capable of handling trillions of events a day.

name: Node.js
description: Node.js is a lightweight web container that is a strong option for development of micro services and as a server to mobile and single-page web applications.

name: Spring Boot
description: Spring Boot allows easy setup of standalone Spring-based applications. It's ideal for pulling up new microservices and easy to deploy.

name: Next.js
description: Next.js is an opinionated, zero-configuration framework that includes simplified routing, automatic compilation and bundling.

name: Python3
description: Python 3 introduced many useful features that are not backward compatible with Python 2.x.

name: FastAPI
description: FastAPI is a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.7+ based on standard Python type hints.

name: React
description: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces, maintained by Facebook and a community of developers.

name: TypeScript
description: A superset of JavaScript that adds static typing, developed and maintained by Microsoft.

name: Django
description: A high-level Python web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design.

name: Flask
description: A lightweight WSGI web application framework in Python, known for its simplicity and flexibility.

name: PostgreSQL
description: A powerful, open-source object-relational database system known for its reliability, feature robustness, and performance.

name: Redis
description: An in-memory data structure store, used as a database, cache, and message broker, known for its high performance and versatility.

name: Terraform
description: An open-source infrastructure as code software tool that provides a consistent CLI workflow to manage hundreds of cloud services.

name: Prometheus
description: An open-source systems monitoring and alerting toolkit originally built at SoundCloud, known for its powerful querying language and time-series data model.

name: Grafana
description: An open-source platform for monitoring and observability, allowing users to query, visualize, alert on, and understand their metrics no matter where they are stored.

name: GitHub Actions
description: A CI/CD platform that allows you to automate your build, test, and deployment pipeline right from GitHub.

name: Jenkins
description: An open-source automation server that enables developers to build, test, and deploy their software.

name: Ansible
description: An open-source automation tool for IT tasks such as configuration management, application deployment, and task automation.

name: Grafana Loki
description: A log aggregation system designed to store and query logs from all your applications and infrastructure.

name: Kong Gateway
description: An open-source API gateway and microservices management layer, delivering high performance and reliability.

name: Helm
description: A package manager for Kubernetes that helps you manage Kubernetes applications.

name: ElasticSearch
description: A distributed, RESTful search and analytics engine capable of addressing a growing number of use cases.

name: Logstash
description: A server-side data processing pipeline that ingests data from multiple sources, transforms it, and then sends it to a 'stash' like Elasticsearch.

name: Kibana
description: An open-source data visualization and exploration tool used for logs and time-series analytics.

name: Fluentd
description: An open-source data collector for unified logging layers, allowing you to collect logs from various sources and unify them in a single platform.

name: OpenTelemetry
description: An open-source observability framework for cloud-native software, providing APIs and SDKs for generating, collecting, and exporting telemetry data.

name: Jaeger
description: An open-source, end-to-end distributed tracing tool used for monitoring and troubleshooting microservices-based distributed systems.

name: NewRelic
description: A cloud-based observability platform that provides real-time insights into application performance and infrastructure health.

name: Datadog
description: A monitoring and analytics platform for developers, IT operations teams, and business users in the cloud age.

name: GitLab CI/CD
description: A built-in continuous integration and continuous deployment tool that comes with GitLab, allowing you to build, test, and deploy your code.

name: CircleCI
description: A continuous integration and continuous delivery platform that automates development workflows.

name: Selenium
description: An open-source tool for automating web browsers, primarily used for testing web applications.

name: Cypress
description: A front-end testing tool built for the modern web, enabling developers to write and run tests for web applications.

name: Cucumber
description: A tool for running automated tests written in plain language, promoting collaboration between technical and non-technical team members.
